problem.markdown:
The engine plant management never heard of the Toyota Production System and they decided to always make exactly \(A\) engines every day.
>>There is a storage buffer for engine inventory between the engine plant and the assembly plant. If the inventory holding cost is $10 per engine per day, what is the average daily cost of inventory per day?<<
= 50
[Explanation] On odd days the engine plant produces A and the assembly plant takes \(A-\Delta A\). On those days the inventory is \(\Delta A\). On even days, the engine plant produces A and the assembly plant takes \(A+\Delta A\), so the inventory goes to 0. Therefore, the average inventory is \(\Delta A/2\). The average daily cost of inventory is \(10\Delta A/2\). [Explanation]
>>What is the average daily cost of labor per day?<<
=8*80*60
[Explanation] The daily average cost is just 8*80*\(W\). [Explanation]
>>What is the total cost of labor + inventory per day?<<
=50+8*80*60
[explanation] This is just the sum of the above two parts [explanation]
